description: Display a global, read-only indicator showing the active Git branch name and version (from package.json) at the top of every page. This provides immediate visibility into which build is running during development, debugging, review, and PR validation.

userStories.title: Display active branch name globally
userStories.description: As a developer or reviewer, I want to see the currently active Git branch name at the top of every page, so I can immediately identify the running context.
acceptanceCriteria: Active branch name is visible at the top of every page
Branch name is read-only and cannot be modified from the UI
Branch name is identical across all pages during a session
Branch name updates correctly when switching branches and rebuilding
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser: branch name is clearly visible on all pages
userStories.notes: Build-time injection via next.config.js. BranchIndicator server component in root layout. Vercel support via VERCEL_GIT_COMMIT_REF fallback.

userStories.title: Display active branch version globally
userStories.description: As a developer or reviewer, I want to see the version associated with the active branch next to the branch name, so I can confirm exactly which build is running.
acceptanceCriteria: Version displayed matches package.json version
Version is displayed next to the branch name
Version format is consistent with existing versioning scheme (e.g. v0.53.x)
Version updates correctly after version bump and rebuild
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser: version matches the expected build
userStories.notes: Version read from package.json via getPackageVersion() at build time. Display format: branch â€¢ v0.53.37. Graceful fallback if version unavailable.

userStories.title: Global visibility on all pages
userStories.description: As a user navigating the application, I want the branch and version indicator to remain visible regardless of which page I am on.
acceptanceCriteria: Indicator is visible on Resume pages
Indicator is visible on Cover Letter pages
Indicator is visible on Job Application pages
Indicator is visible on Dashboard pages
No page hides or overrides the indicator
Indicator positioning is consistent across all pages
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser: indicator visible on all routed pages
userStories.notes: Component in root locale layout inherits to all routes. Z-index increased to z-[60] to render above marketing header (z-50). Verified: dashboard, marketing, and auth pages all inherit correctly.

userStories.title: Locale-safe rendering
userStories.description: As a multilingual user, I want the branch/version indicator to work correctly regardless of the active locale.
acceptanceCriteria: Indicator renders correctly under /en
Indicator renders correctly under /fr
Indicator renders correctly under /de
Indicator renders correctly under /it
Branch name and version are NOT translated
No locale-specific formatting issues occur
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser: indicator works across all locales
userStories.notes: Component is locale-agnostic by design. No i18n imports, no translation functions, uses raw environment variables only. Unicode bullet separator (U+2022) is not locale-dependent.
